output.script: one country's trade war is another country's opportunity That's how India should see this Yes there will be a hit but there will also be opportunities New Delhi's job is to hunt for those chances and one area could be rare earth metals Like I said China has halted the export of these metals to the US It's a move that could US businesses But could India intervene can we plug the gap left by China let's try to answer that tonight First of all what are rare earth metals these are a group of 17 elements in the periodic table Most of them have really weird names like europium or holmium or scandium As weird as they sound they're pretty important You need rare earths to make a number of crucial products like semiconductors electric vehicle motors fighter jets and missiles wind turbines and even your LED lights Basically these are metals of the future And where does China come in well China dominates rare earth production China makes up 70% 70% of all rare earth output They also make up 90% of rare earth magnets These are magnets made from rare earth metals They're key to making EVs Now this dominance is not an accident China identified the importance of rare earths back in the 1990s First they put tight controls on the deposits Rare earths were declared as strategic and protected reserves Then China invested in processing technology Like all ores rare earth has to be extracted and processed And China took the lead in doing that And since then there's been no looking back This near monopoly is worrying for other countries China's latest ban has spooked the White House Listen to what Trump's trade advisor said The rare earth limits are being studied very carefully and they're concerning and we're thinking about all the options right now The US is rightly worried because rare earths go into almost everything even their flagship F-35 fighter jets Normally such crucial inputs would be stocked But reports say most American companies do not have stocks because rare earths are quite costly If you stock them a lot of your cash would be tied up I'm sure they're regretting that decision now But what's the way forward could India play a role here on paper yes Look at the largest reserves of rare earths in our world China is at number one they have around 44 million tons of it Second is Brazil with 21 million tons and India is actually third with 6.9 million tons Australia is fourth with 5.7 million and Russia is at the fifth position So availability is not a problem In fact it never was Don't fall for the name rare earths Most of these metals are not actually rare They're found across the earth Then what is the problem extraction and processing India and the US are hoping to collaborate on this It came up during Prime Minister Modi's recent trip to the White House Both sides agreed to join to jointly explore opportunities The problem is this is going to take time Rare earth's industry cannot be built overnight China's rare earth industry was not built overnight either It has it was created over decades Nonetheless it's important to prepare for the long term to create an alternative rare earth supply chain and Donald Trump is certainly game He is hunting for rare earths in wartorn Ukraine and freezing Greenland So he's clearly desperate for alternatives and India Well last month the government announced a major move It allowed private companies to mine rare earths So clearly India is aware of the opportunity The question is how quickly can we scale it because time is of the essence and I'm not just talking about rare earths I'm also talking about the broader manufacturing pivot India wants to become an alternative to Chinese factories Most policy makers feel that the time is ripe They point to Trump Trump's hefty tariffs on other Asian producers Remember India was tariffed at 26% but other Asian countries faced a much higher tariff So on paper this will help India This should it will make Indian goods more competitive but that alone will not sway companies Producers will look for other factors as well like how cheap are the raw materials how good is the public infrastructure how easy is it to acquire land and set up a business how soon can you settle disputes All these factors affect the final decision of a business perhaps more than tariffs So India's focus should be on creating a robust manufacturing environment Public infrastructure has grown leaps and bounds in the last 10 years The ease of doing business has also improved But clearly more needs to be done If not India could miss the manufacturing bus again Greeting you with aloha and namaste I I love India Presence uh occupation of a territory by another country pertains to India what we saw in Kashmir and the prime minister How do you see Trump's America yes the current administration behaves differently from the previous administration who are trying to bring down the current government in Syria Exactly Iran maybe Russia alternative to Prime Minister Modi committed to South you know cooperations for not over 50% Is Ukraine prepared to pay the price for that peace no compromises at the cost of territorial integrity and sovereignity very much You're Sorry

output.script: sebasti's I recently ran a poll on Instagram and asked what part of your financial Journey do you struggle with most I offered up topics like saving and paying down debt and budgeting but the overwhelming majority of votes went to investing and I know investing can feel super overwhelming because it's so jargon heavy but today I'm gonna break down investing into the simplest of terms using an easy analogy and I'll also explain what to look out for to make sure you have the best portfolio and if all that isn't simple enough I'll even give you an easy hack to Fast Track Your investing Journey let's get to it first things first let me address the big question I always get what exactly do I invest in and the BFFs always think I'm gonna have magically just a list of the 10 best stocks for them to blindly buy just because I said so I hate to break it to you but nobody knows what the perfect investment is everybody wants to find the perfect investment you hedge fund managers and billionaire there's a like are all looking for the best thing and even though hedge funds and billionaires have endless resources unlike us they still can't seem to get it right while I was a Trader on Wall Street I saw hedge funds blow up all the time because people made bad investment decisions so please know there's no such thing as the perfect investment and in fact we need to rewind before you worry about what investments you're gonna buy we need to figure out what's going to hold your Investments so step one you are going to pick an account these aren't Investments themselves they are just online tote bags they hold stuff you can get a special tote bag like a 401k or a 403b or an IRA or a Roth IRA specific for retirement or you could get a tote bag specific for saving for your kiddos education called a 529 or you could get a blank tote bag that you can access at any time called an individual brokerage account for General investing you can research the account types that might make the most sense for you depending on your goals when do you want to have access to that money what are you investing for and you're going to open up one of these at any financial institution this can be with your bank a new fintech with a sleeker online interface if you're more digital first like Sofi which is what I opt for or at one of the old traditional brokerages like a Fidelity Vanguard Schwab or E-Trade then we move on to step two now you're going to fund the account this is literally so simple all you're doing is taking cash out of your checking or savings account at your bank or credit union and putting it into your investment account this is done digitally and most platforms just have you either link your bank account or connect it through plaid simple enough and last step three the fun part we pick Investments and instead of telling you my top 10 Stock picks I'm going to tell you how I buy hundreds of companies at the same time without having to spend a fortune you're going to buy ETFs and mutual funds in particular I like index funds don't let these names or phrases confuse you for the purpose of your investing what you really need to know is that they are essentially just baskets of Investments instead of just buying one company you can access hundreds or thousands at a time one thing I do want you to be on the lookout for When selecting These funds you'd like to invest in is the expense ratio while trading platforms are no longer charging commissions for transactions mutual funds ETFs and other baskets of Investments still do charge a fee I mean someone has to do all the work of putting them together or at least they have to fund the technology that does right and that costs money and these fees are called expense ratios it's a percentage that you'll pay on top of your gains or losses for example say an investment has a 0.1 expense ratio if you make eight percent you'd actually make seven point nine percent if you lost five percent you'd actually have lost five point one percent expense ratios are important because sometimes similar Investments have different expense ratios for example if you wanted an S P 500 tracking ETF you could buy spy but the expense ratio is much higher than vo which essentially does the same thing by choosing vo instead you'd save money annually while accomplishing the same Financial goal and speaking of good funds that offer Diversified Investments here are a few great options but as always this is not Financial advice I don't know your personal situation and please do your own research you can also choose to invest in a Target date retirement fund if you want something more tailored to your age and how close you are to retirement all you have to do is calculate what year you turn 60 and round to the closest year ending in five or zero then pick the target date fund with that year in it my favorite analogy about investing is that it's like walking into a grocery store everybody has a different vehicle to hold their goodies some grab a basket other grab the mini carts other grab full-size carts and heck some people just hold all of their food in their arms some people being me they come into the store with money and then buy things at the store AKA when you're investing you choose an account to hold your Investments you put cash into the account to make those purchases and then you buy stuff but what if you've watched this entire video and you're still thinking to yourself dang I still don't really get it consider investing through a robo advisor this is the simplest set it and forget it investing method so if you're lazy but you want to eventually be rich and get your bag please pay attention I'm going to teach you how Robo advisors are just like your Spotify so you know how Spotify uses your listening data to help build you the perfect playlist you got stuff like discover weekly daily mix release radar well Robo advisors do the same thing except for your Investments you fill out a short survey about your goals risk tolerance and financial situation and then they build you a personalized and diversified investment strategy if you don't have the time or the willpower to learn how to best on your own this is a superb way to still invest without confusing yourself my only flag is that Robo advisors do typically charge an additional fee for human advisors they charge around one percent to manage your money but good Robo advisors charge about a quarter of that so 0.25 or less while you'll pay more in fees to use a robo advisor than if you were to invest on your own if you know yourself and don't think you'll invest period unless someone else does it for you this is still a great option to wrap up this video I want to remind you of two important points by parking your money in a checking account you're losing wealth as the years go on because inflation is going to make your life more expensive and unless you're making upwards of hundreds of thousands of dollars a year you can't realistically save your way to Rich you need to invest your money if you plan on retiring and two please be gentle with yourself just because you haven't invested yet does not mean you're bad with money you are not stupid you're not behind you just haven't ever been taught we pride ourselves on dragging kids through school for 12 years math reading Science History but we don't teach personal finance when it's actually the most important subject that actually impacts every single person I hope this video was able to teach you a little something you never got in class and also gives you the hope that no matter who you are you can and deserve to invest make sure to like And subscribe for more money investing and finance tips I love you guys so much and I'll see you next week

output.script: the IDE race has become incredibly competitive with new vs code Forks emerging almost on a daily nonetheless it is definitely great for the AI space as it encourages more of a competitive environment and I truly love it this week alone we saw codium AI release wind surf IDE which is a new AI gentic IDE that is capable of combining deep code-based understanding with Advanced AI tools to help you develop and code out anything we also also saw the release of a which is a new open- source IDE trying to replicate wind sur's Cascade feature but today we are going back to the IDE that had started the IDE race and that is cursor for the people who do not know cursor is an AI editor that utilizes AI to streamline the development process with AI features like autocomplete code suggestion you have code generation and so much more it's mostly known for its compos comper feature which is cursor composer that allows developers to provide highle instructions for creating entire applications or making complex multifault changes and just today we have a new update called the 0.43 release where there is a new composer UI there's AI agents within the IDE as well as the at recommended function which is something that will semantically search for context this is quite interesting and there's so much more to this so with that thought let's get straight into the video please keep in mind that this update is rolling out meaning that it is not accessible for everyone they're slowly rolling out different access points to various users so just keep that in mind you can still check by going through the next procedure which I'll Showcase in The Next Step I'm going to go ahead and showcase how you can install the new update for the people who have cursor already installed if you do not you can easily just install it off of their website or you can install it for your operating system but now for the people who already have an older version of cursor you can install the new version by simply typing in control or command shift p and this will basically open up the search Tab and then you can easily search for cursor attempt update you can just simply click on this and this will install the latest release of the cursor update let's get started now and take a look at the key features in the cursor 0 43 release starting off with the new composer UI features we now have the composer as a tab where the composer is accessible through the command shift I feature and it's now integrated as a tab in your editor just like any file would be this is actually a huge step forward compared to the old overlay UI which is offering a more intuitive and cohesive workspace for developers this feature of the inline diffs is quite quite big cuz this basically means that it is now going to show directly within the composer chat and it's going to allow you to review changes on the fly so you can accept them right there or choose to open the file for further edits and this will overall streamline the whole review process next up we have the composer agent which is a powerful feature that is going to enhance your coding workflow now this is a pretty big update because composer is going to now bring advanced AI capabilities and this will basically allow for autonomously picking the right context for a task it's going to allow you to interact with the terminal for Automation and debugging and it's going to seamlessly integrate into your existing development process you can easily enable the composer agent by going directly into your composer chat window you can open this chat and you can toggle the agent on and off now you can also do this through the settings where you can navigate through the settings go over to to the editor and then you can head over to chat and composer and you can set the enable tool option to activate the composer agent just take a look at this demo video of this new agent in action you can see that it is being requested to build and run the project that has been provided as context and you can see that it has already analyzed a couple of errors and it's going to go ahead and install the necessary packages for you and in this case it's doing everything autonomously it's it's going to install and create multif files that are necessary for this project it's going to then develop the project by generating the code for it and it's going to also install the necessary packages all by running terminal commands directly in line which you can see right here and at the end you're going to see that it's going to be capable of generating this app for the Mac OS operating system but you see right here now another cool feature is that they have improved semantic search which is a great Improvement that makes the composer agent find files easier with just a few characters and it's going to do it faster and more intuitively it works quite well and it works similarly to vs code search which is going to ensure that there's consistently going to be able to recall the best context that is available there's also this new image dropping experience where they have basically enhanced this by having you hover a file over the composer chat box and it will basically trigger a color change there's no major functional difference but it's just a visual cue that adds a small touch to this enhancement there's also a new pill recommendation in the chat SL composer which is basically something that we haven't seen yet but we're going to soon be able to get a good idea of what this is once they roll out with this update now there's this new feature that isn't actually written in the ch change log it's an experimental feature that's called the bugfinder and essentially it's helping you input: main idea: Create a detailed explainer on how Trumpâ€™s advisors are trying to reshape public perception of inflation, and what economic strategies theyâ€™re pushing behind the scenes..

output.title: How Trumpâ€™s economic team hopes to reset the international financial system | DW News
output.description:
Members of President Donald Trump's economic team are pushing for a total reorganization of the international financial system. The so-called "Mar-a-Lago accord" - named after the president's resort in Florida, aims to tilt the international economy in favor of the US. As part of the scheme, the White House would reclassify trading partners into friends and enemies, and deliberately devalue the US dollar.

00:00 How Trump advisers hope to coerce allies into a dollar devaluation and a US debt reset
03:11 Jessie Yin Assistant Director at the Atlantic Council's GeoEconomics Center talks DW through Trumpâ€™s competing goals

#trump #usdollar #usdebtcrisis 

For more news go to: http://www.dw.com/en/

Follow DW on social media:
â–ºInstagram: https://www.instagram.com/dwnews
â–ºTikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@dwnews
â–ºFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/deutschewellenews/
â–ºTwitter: https://twitter.com/dwnews

FÃ¼r Videos in deutscher Sprache besuchen Sie: https://www.youtube.com/dwdeutsch

Subscribe: https://www.youtube.com/user/deutschewelleenglish?sub_confirmation=1
output.tags: DW News, US economy, Trump, Stephe, Stephen Miran, Plaza Accord, Mar-a-Lago accord
output.script: members of Donald Trump's economic team are pushing for a total reorganization of the international financial system the so-called Mara Lago accord named after the president's resort in Florida aims to tilt the international economy in favor of the United States as part of the scheme the White House would reclassify trading partners into friends and enemies and deliberately devalue the US dollar this is Mara Lago the Florida resort where Donald Trump spends many weekends often with high-profile guests and senior administration officials now lending its name to a bold and potentially destabilizing economic plan the plan aims to devalue the US dollar a symbol of American financial might but according to Donald Trump's economic team the dollar is too strong too many countries want to hold dollars in reserve and that according to the White House team creates a lot of problems a strong dollar makes imports cheaper for US customers and makes US exports more expensive the White House sees that as hurting US manufacturing hollowing out the working class and making the country more dependent on others rather than making things at home in the USA then there's the US national debt well over $30 trillion the annual interest payments are more than the military budget china and other countries sell a lot more goods in the US than they import than they invest in US debt driving up the dollar even more so how do Trump's economists want to fix this with what's being called the Mara Lago accord a framework's been suggested by Trump's Treasury Secretary Scott Bessant and the head of Trump's economic advisory council the idea is to convince other countries to help weaken the dollar and to trade in their US debt holdings for 100year bonds the US would pay way less interest on its debt this isn't something most countries would see as being in their self-interest so how do you convince other countries to act against their financial interests bessent has suggested dividing countries into three categories green for friendly nations red for unfriendly ones and yellow for those in the middle green countries would receive military protection and tariff relief those that don't play along will have high tariffs and no military aid explicitly linking America's military might to its financial power making other countries literally pay for protection one major risk is that more and more countries might turn to China or other nations for trade deals and military stability rather than pay the price to stay friends with the US it's also hard to tell if Trump who often seems to change his mind and reverse course announcing tariffs and then pausing them will stick with any policy for long but the so-called Mara Lago accords do point to a method behind what can otherwise look like a series of impulsive decisions jesse Yin is an assistant director at the Atlantic Council's geoeconomic center she recently wrote an article about this issue for the Atlantic Council called Meeting in Mara Lago is a new currency deal applausible welcome to DW so should we be viewing the Trump administration's changed military priorities and widespread use of tariffs through the lens of this Marilago accord is this the Trump administration getting its ducks in a row well that's certainly one way to look at it and it's really a debate in DC right now about whether these tactics will be feasible in trying to get a weaker US dollar so the Mara Lago accord is also a play on the Plaza Accord from 1985 where West Germany France Japan the United Kingdom and the US came together to intentionally devalue the US dollar and how did that work out so these countries did come to a currency agreement to devalue the US dollar especially against the Japanese yen something that we at the geoeconomic center kind of identified in our article is that the countries that signed onto this agreement and that held these large trade deficits with the US um have very different incentives in 1985 than the countries that currently hold large trade deficits with the US like China Mexico and Vietnam in 1985 the US was providing the security guarantee for these countries meanwhile countries like China Mexico and Vietnam don't have the same incentives to sign on to a currency agreement and that's where uh some of Trump's advisers have come in with this idea of tariffs as a way to bring countries to the negotiation table and is this actively being considered in the White House um I think we kind of have to wait and see uh how far they can sort of push this along a lot of the these concepts come from a report that Steven Mirren who uh is part of Trump's circle of adviserss right now put out last year in September but we're going to have to sort of wait and see uh whether the Trump administration moves forward in exactly this way and and can you answer the question you raised in your article is a new currency deal plausible it would be very difficult and one sticking point is China china is a much bigger player in the global economy nowadays than it was in 1985 it holds the largest trade deficit with the US and the sort of lingering impression of the Plaza Accord in China is a cautionary tale um a lot of people believe that the depreciation of or the appreciation of the Japanese yen against the US dollar led to the bursting of the Japanese e asset bubble and the sort of slow lagging economic growth that Japan has had since the '90s um so in that way with China's own economy sort of slowing down they don't feel incentivized to really appreciate the reimb in any meaningful way okay so if China as you say one of the the biggest holders of US debt if they say no one are interested how big a hole does that put in in the president's plan um I believe that it would put quite a big hole in his plan um the sort of continued and intentional devaluation of the US dollar would bring sort of domestic economic instability as well as destabilizing the global trade system um it would be very difficult to sort of sustain that this does seem like an odd plan from a president who during his first term kept accusing China of manipulating its currency now it looks as though that's exactly what Donald Trump wants to do um it's hard to say whether uh this will actually get pushed through but the idea around a strong dollar versus a weak dollar um a lot of it does come down to these trade deficits um but President Trump has also said that he doesn't want to give up the dominance of the dollar within reserves so there are a few different crossroads of purposes here so if this Marilago accord happens you how does it affect current countries whose currencies are tied to the dollar and as we've mentioned those who who bought American debt do they do they just bystanders uh to this um especially if the Trump administration goes the way of uh implementing more tariffs and tries to go through this unilaterally um a lot of countries would just sort of have to accept how the dollar moves in the market and how does it then affect their economies i'm I'm I'm looking for the sort of the ripple effect of this i mean it would be largely destabilizing um if we look at the historical comparison after um the countries in the plaza accord sort of agreed to devalue the US dollar they eventually gave it up um a few years later and G7 countries have sort of agreement since mid2010s to not engage in these sort of currency agreements anymore and if this happened would it work would it bring more jobs to the United States global trading system and supply chains are a lot more intertangled now than they were so similar to the question of will tariffs bring US uh jobs back and manufacturing it's more of a wait and see I would say okay thanks for that Jesse Yin from the Atlantic Council thank you so much

output.script: most of us watching this video earn money in some way but do you have any idea about personal finance if not do you know where to start are you aware of where you spend or overspend in your monthly expenses where are you heading financially to be honest the answers to all of these questions are difficult for many to answer which is why it's really important to address them hey guys and welcome back to the channel if you're watching then there's a high probability that you're interested in money so let's start from the beginning and talk about the basics of personal finance after all what good is it to talk about the intricacies of money if we don't discuss where and how to start what is personal finance or we can continue it's necessary to discuss what personal finance actually means personal finance is the management of one's finances through planning spending saving and investing it's the management of all areas of your and your family's finances both short-term and long term the phrase also refers to an entire business committed to services and products meant to assist you in managing your finances and taking advantage of investment possibilities personal finance is an essential component of not just managing your day-to-day Financial demands but also planning for your financial future the sooner you master personal finance the better your long-term Financial chances will be for things like investing and retirement planning you can better identify possibilities to improve your finances if you grasp the elements of personal finance this understanding can assist you in budgeting for immediate Necessities while also planning for long-term financial goals the sooner you begin financial planning the better even if you think that boat has sailed remember it's never too late to set Financial objectives to provide Financial Security and freedom for yourself and your family here are the top personal finance habits and tips one set specific financial goals for everyone financial success holds a different definition for some it's having a credit score above 800. retiring before the age of 50 or assisting your children in avoiding student loan debt Others May define success as owning a car second property on the beach or traveling the world as with anything in life not just your money if you want to be successful you must have a clear strategy you cannot expect to Fumble your way to achieving your financial goals you must put thought effort and intentionality to determine just what you want in your financial life remember that your goals should be achievable and realistic or else you will soon lose motivation because you'd have no way to truly track them two begin budgeting budgeting is one of the fundamentals of personal finance some might argue that it is the fundamental to personal finance to Define it in a single sentence budgeting is keeping track of your incoming expenses so you know where your money is going each month when done correctly a budget puts you in charge of your finances it allows you to spend more on things you enjoy and less on things you don't it allows you the flexibility to shift as life happens and new problems or priorities arise a quick Google or check on your phone's app store show you any number of budgeting apps designed to help you automate your life and make the process of tracking easier apps like mint you need a budget and personal capital three establish an emergency fund paying yourself first ensures that money is set aside for unforeseen needs such as medical bills a major car repair increase in expenses and more the optimal safety net is to have an emergency fund of three to six months worth of living expenditures Financial experts normally advise saving 20 of your pay to help you achieve this goal this may not be a quick thing some people take several months or years to save up enough for a rainy day fund but don't get unmotivated if you look at the big picture it will be the emergency fund that saves you in trying times continue allocating as much as you can preferably at least 20 percent to this goal four reduce debt to prevent debt from spiraling out of control don't spend more than you earn of course that's often easier said than done and the truth is most people must borrow from time to time also going into debt can occasionally be advantageous for example if it leads to the acquisition of an asset taking out a mortgage to buy a property is an example of this still take a hard look at what items you're obligating yourself to paying off if it is not debt that allows you to build an asset or something that helps you bring in income be very cautious about obligating yourself to paying it back this includes things like cars Tech appliances and any Myriad of items that you're tempted to put on your credit card five investing investing is the acquisition of assets that are projected to create a rate of return in the belief that the individual would get more money than they first invested investing does involve some risk so ensure you know and understand what you're investing in completely before you put your hard-earned money into it investing is one of the most challenging aspects of personal finance and one of the areas where many people seek professional help the most there are significant disparities in risk and reward among various assets and most people seek assistance with this part of their financial plan risk tolerance is different from person to person and knowing your own will help you determine the best ways for you to invest 6. use credit cards with caution credit cards can be significant financial traps but it's almost impossible to survive without one in today's world additionally they are a crucial component to help build your credit score and a terrific tool to track spending which can be a huge budgeting help credit simply needs to be managed correctly which means paying off your entire bill every month or at the very least keeping your credit usage ratio low that is keeping your account balances below 30 percent of your total available credit given the incredible rewards incentives available these days such as cashback and points it can make sense to use your credit card more often as long as you pay your bills in full remember never use your credit card to their maximum limits and always pay your payments on time paying bills late or missing payments is one of the quickest ways to destroy your credit worthiness if you're honest with yourself and no credit cards will get you into trouble then cut it up and use a debit card this is not about ego you must do what you must to help get you to your financial goals seven think about your family when the time approaches all of us will die one day we cannot Escape it but doing certain things can ensure that your wishes and finances carry on it's never easy to think about things like this but making your wishes known to the necessary individuals in your family will only help in the long run create a will and depending on your needs set up one or more trusts to protect the Assets in your estate and ensure that your desires are carried out after you die it would be best to consider a car home life disability and long-term care insurance review your policies regularly to ensure that it matches your family's needs during life's big milestones eight take some time off the pursuit of personal finance will span Decades of your life budgeting planning saving and investing can often be very tiring exercises make sure to treat yourself every now and again so that you don't get demotivated ultimately life is short so enjoy some of the fruits of your labor whether it's a vacation a purchase or a night out this provides you with a taste of the Financial Freedom you are working so hard for also delegate when necessary even if you can do your own taxes or manage a portfolio of individual equities this does not imply you should setting up a brokerage account and spending a few hundred dollars on a certified public accountant or a financial planner might be an excellent approach to help your planning when you have financial literacy you grasp all of the facts tools and principles required to manage your money wisely unfortunately financial literacy is not taught in many school systems if you want to be successful with your finances you must seek out this information taking the time to learn and grow in the basics of personal finance can only help you on your way toward Financial Freedom that's the end of today's video If you learned something new today like this video and share it with your friends please consider subscribing and hit that Bell icon to get notified when new videos Drop we'll see you in the next one

output.tags: gymnastics, tumbling, flips, how to do gymnastics
output.script:
hey friends it's Rylie I'm a former gymnast and current cheerleader if you actually wanna be able to hold it you should never start with a handstand that looks like this I used to be terrible at handstands but now I can easily hold it for over 30 seconds because of this method I'm about to teach you first this might be obvious but working on your handstands puts a lot of pressure on your wrists so properly warm them up by moving and stretching them now we are going to build strength and learn how to balance on our hands with two exercises first try what I like to call a TP kneel on the floor and place your hands shoulder width apart right in front of your knees from there straighten your legs into a downward dog position start to lean forward which will likely pull you up onto your toes the goal is to eventually hold most of your body weight in your arms and hands using your feet mostly for balance next if you can try practicing your balance in a frogstand place your hands in front of you and then open to a wide squat lean forward and bend your elbow slightly allow them to fit in the crooks of your knees when you feel secure lean forward even more than point your toes which should allow you to now be balanced solely on your hands use this as an opportunity to practice shifting your weight and using your hands to keep you balanced next let's break down proper technique and what each body part should be doing in a handstand starting with hands place them shoulder width apart and spread your fingers wide you do not want flat hands but instead to look like you are gripping the floor with crunched fingertips you also want the majority of your body weight and balance to be placed in your fingers not back on your palms as for your arms keep these tight and straight moving onto shoulders it is crucial that you keep them shrugged think like when you make this I don't know movement you're pulling your shoulders up to your ears in a handstand this is what relax shoulders look like versus when they're shrugged again here's an example of relax shoulders versus shrugged or where your head is placed tilt your head slightly up and look at your hands you don't wanna stick it out or even have a neutral head but enough tilt to make direct eye contact with your fingers finally we're going to talk about body and leg placement and learn about a stack the key to a good handstand if you have access to this find a large elevated surface that is above knee and below hip level like a mat or a bed kneel on the edge and lean over placing your hands on the ground straighten your legs to a TP and find the point where your hips shoulders and hands are in a stacked line film yourself from the side to see if you hit this position here are a
couple of examples of what a break in the stack line looks like notice how one or more pieces of my body sticks out from this line when you are doing this stack correctly and feel like you are balanced without moving anything else try lifting one leg at a time and balancing eventually again not moving anything in the stack try lifting a second leg and balancing which may take some time in practice here's a visual example of how sensitive the stack is if you watch this closely you can see how I ever so slightly shifted my hips back which ruined the stack and caused me to it's easier to learn from the mat but alternatively you can also try this on a wall sit so that your feet are flat against the wall and your legs are straight Mark where your hands are supposed to go by placing your fingers in line with where your butt is sitting climb up the wall and find your stack your hips and legs should be a little more open than a 90 degree angle again practice bringing one leg off the wall notice my foot against the wall is pointed when you have a good balance and feel like there's almost no way against that foot flex it if you're in the correct stack this should result in you holding a balanced handstand when you're ready to take this off the wall avoid kicking up from standing in a lunge because this is less controlled instead I highly suggest starting with both hands on the ground and kicking up which is much easier to help you find that stack I also recommend continuing to hold from this slight split since it is just so much easier to balance and adjust from thank you guys so much for watching I hope this really helps your handstands and subscribe to stay tuned for more tutorials and gymnastics slash tumbling related videos

output.title: New CNN poll shows what Americans think about Trumpâ€™s handling of the economy
output.description: Americans are not impressed with President Donald Trumpâ€™s stewardship of the economy, according to a new CNN poll conducted by SSRS, putting him underwater on the nationâ€™s top issue even as he sees ratings among the best of his presidential career on other key priorities.  #CNN #News
output.tags: latest news, Happening Now, Trump Tariffs, President Donald Trump, Trump Administration, Canada Tariffs, Mexico Tariffs, Inflation, US Economy, Canada US Relations, Trump Traiff Threat, Dairy Tariff, Lumber Tariff, One World, Alayna Treene, Trump Approval Rating, CNN Poll, Sara Sidner, Kate Bolduan, CNN News Central, Marc Short, Karen Finney, David Chalian
output.script: We have a new look on how Americans are feeling about those tariffs, about this trade war, and about the president's handling of it all. In his first six weeks of the second term. New CNN polling out just this morning, showing that Americans are not happy with how President Trump is handling the economy right now. And that's even before the major market selloff that we've seen this week. But still, on some key issues, he is seeing some of his best numbers of his entire presidential career. Joining us right now, CNN, Washington bureau chief and political director David Shelton. Thanks for waking up early, David. Let's start with the overall approval rating in this moment. Where does it stand for President Trump? We have President Trump in our brand new poll at 45% approval. This is for his handling of his job. Overall, 54% disapproval. So upside down obviously underwater Kate. But look at that 45% number over time for Donald Trump in his entire first term. That was his high watermark that we had in CNN polling. It appeared in eight years ago, March 2017, around this time, in his first time around and towards the end of his presidency, at the beginning of Covid, will rally around the president moment in May of 2020. That's when he hit 45%. He left office with a 34% approval rating in 2021. So this 45% that he's at right now. That was his actual high watermark last time around. Yeah I mean it's like underwater. But better than better than he's done. the economy of course, remains an issue, top of mind and of concern for most Americans, likely only getting more top of mind and more of concern. What are Americans saying in this poll about how they think the president is handling all of this? With a relevant note that this poll was conducted, began and ended before the massive stock stock market selloff that we've seen this week. Yes, but not before the chaos we've seen over the last three weeks. And I think that is reflected in the numbers here. You are right. The economy is issue number one by far for Americans, as indicated in this poll. His approval rating on this issue is 44%. Trump's disapproval rating 56% of Americans disapprove of his handling of the economy. We've never seen him that far. underwater and upside down in terms of approval and disapproval on this issue in his entire presidential career. look here, it's usually a strong suit for him. You see, we've had him at 44% approval before, but never with 56% disapproval. So that 12 point, you know, -12 point spread, if you will, that's the largest on issue number one for Americans we've ever had him in our polling. So how are people feeling more broadly than not just about the president, his hand and more broadly about the Trump administration so far? Take a look. You noted at the top some of his scores on some issues are the best he's ever had. Immigration. He's a majority approval. 51% of Americans approve of what Donald Trump is doing on immigration. he's close to half, on managing the federal government and the federal budget. But, you see, there's his overall job approval, 45%. We were talking about the economy right there at 44%. Health care policy, foreign affairs and tariffs. Only 39% approve of the way Donald Trump is handling tariffs. We also asked, how are things going in the country today. And take a look, Kate 35% say, well, 65% say badly. But good news for this white House potentially in January that 35% number was 29%. So a little bit of an uptick in the last month in in the perception of people saying how things are going in the country, there really is a lot in this poll to consider and a lot of nuance in how Americans are feeling about their federal government and how they're interacting with it right now. And Trump's handling. Be very interesting how the President Trump himself interprets us. We have the new CNN polling this morning, and there's a lot of interesting stuff in here. He President Trump has a 45% approval rating, a 54% job, a job disapproval that matches in terms of approval that matches his highest rating of his first term. And he's getting big marks in areas like handling of immigration. 51% approve of what he's doing, and that's seven points higher than any point in his first term. And then here's the but then you look at the issue that people care most about the economy. 56% disapprove worse than any point in his first term. If you were still sitting in the white House and you see this, what's what's your take from this? I think there's a several points to kind of breakdown. One is that the president's greatest foil has been the Democrats and their in effect, this to have a message. And again, when you see like the state of the Union speech and Al Green shaking a cane like an angry old man, I think it gives the president much of an advantage. I think some of those numbers reflected the fact that he's a tremendous contrast to the Joe Biden presidency. They see an energetic president taking action. I think they elected him on two principle issues the border and the economy. So the border, I think they like seen it. I think when Democrats take positions in support of the Columbia University protester, I think it continues to elevate that issue. That helps Trump the economy is a big warning sign. I don't totally agree with Karen. I think he has more running room because he still has such control over the party, and members are concerned about being primaried if Donald Trump goes against them, and that gives him a lot more latitude. But I do think it's a warning sign, because that's what they elected him on in large parts in the economy. And if they lose confidence the way he's handling the economy, it's going to continue to drive his numbers down. I mean, just look at the take this podium and look at it through the lens of of a Democrat. Karen, you see this. And Democrats should take take take from take what from it. They should be on offense on the economy. There is no reason to be hemming and hawing, which we're seeing from some of my Democrats. they need to be on offense. They need to be talking about the fact that, again, this is this chaos that we're seeing is created by Republicans, were created by Trump, created by Musk, or compounded by Musk. And the people are starting to say, hey, this is not what we thought we were getting with this second Trump term. And they need to be bullish about it. And and also to stand up to the Republicans and say, we will not accept this C.R. because it is you're not being honest with the American people about what it really does. It actually would give more power and authority to, Trump and Musk to do more damage, to create more chaos, not to mention, just say, because I'm here in DC, the devastating impacts of a $1 billion cut here in Washington where we already don't have enough police officers and firefighters. So I think there's no reason for them not to stand up today. The Senate this is for you, Chuck Schumer, and be bullish about the fact that we have this is this economic chaos has to stop. And they've got to use the little bit of leverage that they have today to try to do something about it. Marc, short thought bubble right now on the CR is like my favorite big right now. Who gets blame? I'm sorry Chris, my EP, he's like please, please I need to take Karen's advice. The Democrats get blamed for a shutdown and stuff and then we'll find out. We may find out our friends Karen's great to see you control everything. A lady is at the white House for us. Elena. Economists are there more than alarmed this morning about what this might mean. But the president, how is he reacting? seeing what happened with the markets yesterday and hearing from some of the top economists to say, hey, if this keeps going, we could find ourselves in a recession. Look, the president seems to be very dug in on tariffs. Not only are we hearing that in some of his public comments, but that's what I'm hearing as well. Privately, in my conversations with white House officials from those close to him advising him on some of this policy, the president really believes that the United States is being taken advantage of. Sarah, he believes that tariffs are negotiating tactic. And he acknowledges, that, you know, obviously the stock market has been on a downward spiral for the last two days. He's erased. It's really erased all the gains we've seen since the president was elected in November. But he believes that if you stick with him, things will go better moving forward. And he even warned yesterday that tariffs could perhaps go even higher. But I want to take a listen to what he said about the stock market, as he's really been kind of continuing to brush off some of that sharply, you know, lower numbers that we've been seeing. Take a listen. Markets are going to go up and they're going to go down. Yeah. But you know what? We have to rebuild our country. So there you have it. He said they're going to go up. They're going to go down. We have to rebuild our country. That is really, again, what I'm hearing behind closed doors, why the president is so dug in on this. But one thing that's been really interesting and what I'm picking up on, I know some other, reports have said this as well as not only with Wall Street, but also those on the other end of Pennsylvania Avenue in Congress, a lot of people raising the alarm not only about, you know, obviously, Trump's tariff policy, a lot of that is controversial, but also questioning whether there is a bigger strategy here. What is the long term goal on this, and how do they really see the markets stabilizing in the long term? Now, this is, of course, a question as well that many people, many of those business leaders that the president met with yesterday had questions of this is what one of them told our CNN's Jeff Zeleny. They said, quote, there was no new clarity or certainty on what that broader strategy is. Now, we are going to hear from the president today. I'm wearing green. We're going to hear from as well, when he meets with Ireland's, t shock. Essentially, our Prime Minister, I think you can expect a lot of questions on this because, again, the markets are going down. People are seeing their 401 K's on a downward spiral as well. A lot of concerns and a lot of questions and not a lot of clarity from this white House. Other than that they believe in tariffs and they plan to continue moving forward with them.

output.title: How A Family Allegedly "Ruined" Sri Lanka's Economy | The Big Steal
output.description:
Sri Lanka is bankrupt  and protestors blame the current economic crisis on just one family. 
 
For the past 20 years the Rajapaksas have been in power, theyâ€™ve been accused of financial mismanagement at best and siphoning millions of public funds at worst. But they have never been convicted of any crimes. 

At the time of publishing, Ranil Wickremesinghe has been appointed the president of Sri Lanka. former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa had fled to Singapore. The Supreme Court of Sri Lanka has imposed an overseas travel ban on his brothers,  Mahinda Rajapaksa and Basil Rajapaksa.

output.script: by Saturday the pressure on the government was overwhelming with tens of thousands protesting outside the presidential headquarters [Music] at the time this video was filmed Sri Lanka was witnessing unprecedented political turmoil on July 10 thousands of protesters stormed president gotabaya rajapatsa's official residence some even went for a swim in his pool napped on his bed and worked out in his gym president gotabaya has resigned and fled the country [Music] this has happened again economy that had been spiraling out of control leaving citizens unable to afford fuel medicines milk powder or even toilet paper Sri Lanka has now collected over 50 billion dollars in foreign debt and owes 78 million dollars in interest alone for the first time in its history the nation has defaulted on its debt payments protesters blame the current economic crisis on just one family for the past 20 years the rajapoxas have been in power they've been accused of financial mismanagement at best and stealing millions of public funds at worst but here's the kicker none of the top dogs in the rajapoxa clan have ever been convicted of any crime this is a story of how one family allegedly bankrupted an entire nation and got away with it this is the big Steel [Music] the Roger boxer patriarch was D.A rajapaksa a wealthy Plantation owner who was a member of parliament from 1947 to 1965. together D.A rajapaksa and His Four sons mahinda gotabaya chamal and basil have created a political Dynasty that has lasted two decades mahinda Rose to power as a member of parliament in 1970. he was later elected as president in 2005 and as prime minister in 2006. his brothers captured important posts as well in 2010 and 2015 over 40 rajapaksa family members occupied government positions sparking concerns of nepotism but the family maintained a firm grip on Sri Lankan politics by Fanning nationalist sentiment mahinda especially positioned himself as a strong man and savior claiming that majoritarian Senegalese identity was under threat he doubled down in that message in 2009 when he had got a bio were credited for ending the Sri Lankan Civil War a conflict between Tamil Rebels and the government that began in 1983. these men we were told have been to within a few kilometers of the Tamil Tigers de facto capital of kilonochi this Victory came at a great cost according into a U.N estimate around 100 000 people were killed including forty thousand Tamil civilians despite concerns from the US and the UK of Human Rights abuses during the war the rajapaxas managed to stay in power the end of the war itself has saved the lives of so many youth whether it is in the North or the South so we have done that is it a crime in 2005 two important things happened first the Roger Parker Brothers took over Ministries that controlled over three quarters of the national budget and second corruption allegations began to melt in 2006 opposition politician Kabir Hashim accused Mahindra of diverting eight hundred twenty thousand dollars of Aid into a private account this money was supposed to help the nation rebuild after the devastating 2004 tsunami [Music] but mahinda flipped the script and took police investigators to court for damaging his reputation the Court ruled in mahinda's favor and the case was dropped the money later reappeared at the country's Central Bank but setting aside allegations of theft the Roger boxes were accused of gross Financial mismanagement too some say the family's excessive spending on government projects is one of the core reasons for Sri Lanka's current crisis when the 210 million dollar matala rajapasca International Airport opened in his hometown in 2013. mahinda thought it would be his crowning achievement but a year later it was a complete flop only earning 120 dollars for an entire month which is less than the income of a Street restaurant by 2015 it was empty defunct and partly converted into a warehouse for rice expensive white elephant projects that don't generate income have become symbolic of the rajapox's overspending where's these deals suffer from a complete lack of transparency projects in aratna a political opponent has accused Mahindra of forging illegal deals worth 5 billion dollars and critics say that may very well be just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to corruption among the rajapaxas the youngest brother basil the ex-finance minister was nicknamed Mr 10 for allegedly taking millions in commissions from government contracts in 2015 he was charged with stealing 530 000 from a welfare housing program but was granted bail later like his brothers gotabaya the former president has dodged his fair share of graft accusations he was under scrutiny in 2016 when an anti-bribery agency indicted him for squandering 75 million dollars of state income by allowing a private company to maintain a floating Armory he was also charged for embezzling 185 thousand dollars for the construction of a museum dedicated to his father but both cases were eventually dropped when gotabaya was defense secretary he was nicknamed The Terminator for his fiery temper and alleged murderous disposition he was accused of operating a secret death squad that covertly traveled in white Vans attacking dissidents and journalists the impunity over the years has been supervasive that it has apparently trickled down to the next generation of rajapaxas mahinda sons have both been accused of laundering millions of dollars through different businesses namal was a cabinet secretary and remains A Member of Parliament while yoshita was the chief of staff of the Prime Minister the Roger poxus have denied all of these allegations saying they're politically motivated witch hunts and international conspiracies to bring down the family but beyond corruption and power Place Sri Lanka's downfall boiled down to simple bad governance should announce sweeping tax cuts in 2019 the country's budget deficit grew to 14 of its GDP most of the revenue is being used to pay off loans so International credit rating agencies were forced to downgrade Sri Lanka even the governor of the Central Bank appealed to Citizens overseas for donations in U.S dollars Sterling or Euros to augment the nation's budget for the importation of Essentials like food and Medicine after an internal power struggle mahinda and the cabinet resigned earlier this year while gotabaya fled the country and also resigned to pacify the public earlier he also appointed political rival Runner wikimasinga as prime minister and even promised not to contest elections again but Sri Lankan say this isn't enough although wiko masinga is from an opposition party he is still considered a political Insider in Sri Lankan politics even when the rajapoxas were out of power control only shuffled between members of a rich Elite political class they're like spokes on the same wheel replacing each other after elections promising to be tough on their Rivals But ultimately continue to jump together because they all benefit from the prevailing system as of July 2022 Sri Lanka's economy is still paralyzed they're out of food Fuel and even electricity the government has raised taxes to generate Revenue forced shutdowns to save fuel and incentivized officials to take up farming in order to boost the economy but the nation needs six billion dollars to bounce back and survive the next six months glaring mismanagement by the Roger boxer family has dealt a huge blow to Sri Lanka's Economic Development but the current crisis may have spelled the end of a once powerful Dynasty and could Usher in a new era of politics in Sri Lanka [Music]

output.title: How to INSTANTLY improve your PHYSIQUEğŸ‘€ (posing tutorial)
output.description:
Learn how to instantly improve your physique with this posing tutorial from Noel Deyzel. Whether you're a bodybuilder or just want to look your best, these tips will help you perfect your poses and show off your hard work in the gym!

This video introduces popular poses such as the front double bicep, explaining each step of the pose from the ground up, including proper positioning and muscle focus.
- The side chest pose is also broken down, with details on angling oneself towards the camera, positioning the feet, hands and shoulders, and eliminating negative space to better showcase the physique.
- The "crab" or "most muscular" pose is another one explained, with the importance of activating all muscles, perfecting the amount of bend and the correct arm positioning.
- The presenter informed common mistakes that many people make during these poses and ways to avoid them, giving useful tips for practicing and perfecting the poses.
I hope you liked the video, thank you so much for watching!

DISCLAIMER* with any posing you need to use your own discretion to adjust the poses to your physique. With the side chest, I do more of a modern "bodybuilding" side chest compared to a "classic" side chest because I feel that looks better on my frameğŸ˜ŠğŸ™ Of course each pose is going to vary!

Chapters:
00:00 Introduction
00:20 Front Double Bicep Pose (How to do it) 
01:06 Side Chest Pose (How to do it) 
02:39 Most Muscular Pose (How to do it) 

Full workouts + recipes & many more available on my app! (free + premium)ğŸ‘‡
https://apps.apple.com/us/app/noel-deyzel-app/id6474744335
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=io.beefit.noeldeyzelacademy
 
RYSE Supplements
(Use code "NOEL" for 15% off your purchase)
https://ryse.rfrl.co/9mv5w

YoungLa Gym|Fitness|Bodybuilding Clothing
Code '"NOEL" gets you 15% off
https://www.youngla.com/discount/NOEL

output.tags: posing bodybuilding, Posing, posing bodybuilding mr olympia, posing bodybuilding tips, posing bodybuilding arnold, posing bodybuilding tutorial, noel deyzel, daddy noel, deyzel, noel deyzel traps, physique posing tutorial, physique posing tips, men physique posing tamil, bodybuilding posing practice, bodybuilding posing tips, bodybuilding posing for beginners, bodybuilding posing competition, bodybuilding posing for begginers, bodybuilding posing motivation
output.script: have you ever seen those MMA fests that do a front double bicep well I don't know why someone hasn't taught them to pose because they can do it a lot better but Jokes Aside posing is an odd form and I quote you can put all the work into your physique but if you don't know how to pose you're not going to look good so whether you're stepping on stage or simply want the best pictures for social media we're going to run through a step-by-step tutorial through the most popular poses starting off with the front double bicep you'll see a lot of guys posing like this and we can improve it a lot so with any pose you want to start from the ground up so stand shoulder width apart and flare your quads next reach up like you're doing a lat pull down this is to get the Mind muscle Connection in your back so that you can Flex it properly now bring your arms down in the same lat pull down motion and scrunch your back try imagine you're squeezing a pencil between your shoulder blades now flare your lats outward this may be a challenge for you if it's your first time but it's going to take some mind muscle connection and some practice now flex your biceps by throwing your thumbs backwards this helps to display your Peak better now Al together it should look something like this here's the before and after now of of course we all have different frames and bodies with any posing you need to adapt the poses to suit your physique and for the next pose I see this butchered the most because it is a little challenging this is the side chest now there are multiple ways that you can do this pose but this is how I do it start by facing yourself parallel to the camera or audience and anger yourself ever so slightly outward I'll explain why this is important a little bit later next keep your feet like this with this section of your outer foot in your inner foot bend your knees a little and push your hamstring against your knee and you can see see this is one of the tricks that the professionals use moving to the upper body stick your arm out just like this with your other hand scoop your PEC and place it on your wrist now flex your bicep and tricep against one another and twist into position now this is where the feet position comes into play because with our feet angled outwards it makes our waist appear smaller lastly make sure your shoulder is back in order to display your chest the biggest mistake I see with this pose is that a lot of people leave negative space with their arm and of course this doesn't do your physique the justice that it should another mistake is that whisky shoulder some people tend to keep it either too far forward or too far back now again this is where you're going to have to use your own discretion and adjust it to your physique and for the next Poe the crab also known as the most muscular you can see why it's called the crab so as always starting from the ground up H your legs shoulder width apart and flare your quads or alternatively you could do the quad stomp next reach up to the ceiling and all in one motion wash the windows lean forward and flex everything that's why it's called the most muscular because you're flexing everything something a lot of people struggle with this pose is trap activation if you can't get it right what I recommend is get some dumbbells have them in front of you and shrug do it nice and slow and you're going to develop that connection biggest mistakes I see with this pose is not getting the bend right some people either lean too far forward or not enough and next is the arm position some people tend to close themselves off too much and cover their physique I mean the whole point of posing is to display your physique so give all these poses some practice let me know which you're struggling with and if there's any others you'd like to see I hope you enjoyed this I'll see you next time

output.script: US president Trump alongside the Secretary of Defense and Air Force generals unveiled the long awaited Next Generation Advanced man fighter part of the angad family of systems so what do we know about it its name is going to be the f-47 where did that come from who the heck knows f-35's designation had already skipped a lot of numbers throwing logic out of the window and history is repeating itself curiously the current Trump's presidency is 47th in the US History anyway the contract was won by Boeing which may be due to Air Force's dissatisfaction with locked Martin all that's known about plan's appearance comes from two image renders released by The Air Force they show a plane with a very distinct Chine starting from the planes nose one of the images pretty clearly suggests canards with a high dihedral angle meaning pointing upwards the other image doesn't show those cannards though the whole image is more artistic and more of the plane is hidden in the clouds and Vapor curiously the wings seem to have the same dihedral angle that is quite unusual and likely there due to stealth reasons planes like F22 F35 and China's j20 and j36 all have a potential radar signal trap when looked from the side right where the wing meets the lower fuselage f47 seems to be avoiding that spot with a single diamondlike cross-section when looked at From Below or the sides there is of course some similarity with boing's bird of prey demonstrator aircraft that was a tiny plane which flew in the 1990s it allegedly managed such a low Rader cross-section that it could be seen by naked eye but not tracked by fighter jet radar even from just a few miles away its alleged radar cross-section value was -70 DB orders of magnitude less than f-22s - 40 DB and that was with 30-year-old stealth technology the rear half of the f47 is not visible so nothing can be really said about it but two more details are interesting one the canopy looks fairly wide compared to the rest of the plane and two the front landing gear shows a single wheel unlike for example the twin landing gear of the much bigger and heavier Chinese j36 fighter so it's seems plausible that this plane is not really some huge 50ft wingspan 70t long Behemoth it's quite plausible that it's around F22 size or even smaller sure it's theoretically possible the wide cockpit features side by-side seating but would the plane then have a single wheel front landing gear probably not for the longest time the Air Force hinted at the need for the six gen fighter possibly being quite large and heavy that seems to be the route China picked with with its j36 but since last year the Air Force also suggested a smaller F35 sized plane might also be viable this may indeed be what we are seeing now with the shown f47 renders the Air Force also released this statement by General olvin its Chief of Staff various expected superlatives are used f47 is to be the most advanced lethal and most adaptable fighter ever but some Curious details also followed it's designed to outpace outmatch and outmaneuver any adversary now outmaneuvering is strange as NextGen planes are generally not considered to put focus on maneuverability due to lack of large control surfaces but it could be that maneuverability mentioned there is more like agility that General Alvin isn't talking about turning instead he may be talking about plane's ability to rapidly change location and altitude that might be achieved by its next Generation engines combining best of Both Worlds turbo fan mode for fuel efficiency and turbo jet mode when power is needed General's statement also holds several eyebrow razors the f-47 will have significantly longer range than us fifth generation Fighters F35 holds the edge there with nearly 900 M of combat radius in an air-to-air Mission now how can a small-sized fighter jets significantly outrange that while those Advanced engines have been in development for a long time and engine makers touted at least 25% in fuel efficiency savings F35 is also an over-engineered multi-roll plane it's designed to fly for 40 years hauling bombs F 47's airframe may be designed to last just half as long indeed some years ago the Air Force was exploring successive iterative designs to quickly replace one another rather than sticking with a single design for decades and F4 7 may be designed to only hold a few amam sized air-to-air missiles if there are indeed going to be more than five drones accompanying each f47 which the Air Force strongly hinted at earlier there may not be need for more than four or so missiles as the drones would really be the missile carriers and Shooters novel construction methods using metal printing combined with all set so far might allow more room for fuel and less weight leading to not just 25 but perhaps perhaps even 50% more range over the F35 in theory the plane may have just one engine which might lead to further weight savings General Alvin also admitted multiple xplain demonstrators flew for The Last 5 Years and at f47 has unprecedented maturity so much so that the Prototype will fly during Trump's presidency meaning by 2028 at the latest that's indeed a bit quicker than F35 or F22 flu after being selected that being said several more years always elapse for testing and refinements after the first flight so first serial produced airframes may not reach the Air Force before 2032 or so with initial operational capability declared around 2035 or so that's bov's guess of course even that would be slightly quicker induction into service than the past fighter jets had furthermore the f-47 was quoted to cost less than the F22 with the Air Force having more of them in the inventory once again that points to the design not being some huge super Advanced Starship but a more manageable design perhaps in between of F35 and F22 in size only more advanced cost is a relative thing the sole fact there are to be more planes means the overall cost can be split among more airf frames to get a lower price per airframe after many produced even FlyAway cost can be kept low that's why the F35 is currently cheaper than the F-15 EX in previous years before a small scale option was muled andad was described as costing multiple hundreds of millions and that only 200 or so might be affordable so this may be another indication that we are looking at a smaller cheaper solution but with drone formations and tanker aircraft a super large air Cruiser may not be needed future will surely bring more more info on the f47 but it seems the US has been preparing itself for this for quite some time perhaps even before the alleged paus in angat program which came in the summer of 2024 Boeing has had new buildings constructed even before that and we will conclude this video with a curious thought what if the seeming inclusion of canards Boeing as the winner and the overall size all suggest that the Navy's design is going to be a variant of the Air Force one we will see but boing winning that contract too is looking rather plausible come mid 2030s us adversaries may get to see just how much of a capability leap the f-47 is and of hopes we will learn about the plane more even sooner so we can do a comparison video with the Chinese six gen Fighters

output.title: Is India Interested In Buying The F-35 Fighter Jets From The US Air Marshal Anil Khosla  The GAP
output.description:
Is India Interested In Buying The F-35 Fighter Jets From The US Air Marshal Anil Khosla  The GAP

In Episode 18 of The Gaurav Arya Podcast, Major Gaurav Arya (Retd.) interacts with Air Marshal Anil Khosla (Retd.). Air Marshal Anil Khosla PVSM, AVSM, VM, is a former Vice Chief of Air Staff (VCAS) of the Indian Air Force and AOC in C of Eastern Air Command.  He was actively involved in formulating Air Force War Plans, Force structure planning, and capability building, as well as handling important air operations in recent times. Today, in conversation with Major Gaurav Arya, he talks about India's quest for 5th-generation fighter jets. He initially talks about the Chinese Air Force and tells how it is overpowering countries like the US in terms of numbers. He also discusses China's J-20 program and compares it with the US' F-35 jet. Going deep into India's 42 squadrons strength, he talks about the desired strength to counter threats like China. From AMCA to Atmanirbharta in defence, Air Marshal Anil Khosla briefs on everything in this new episode of The Gaurav Arya Podcast. Watch The Gaurav Arya Podcast now, and don't forget to subscribe to The Chanakya Dialogues English.
